panels.description:
Total number of unapplied transactions from produced blocks using delta

This is the current number of transactions in the unapplied transaction queue. The unapplied transaction queue is the queue of transactions that have been aborted out of a speculative block (or forked block). Also includes trxs that have entered the node when it is not producing a block.
panels.title: Total Unapplied Transactions from Produced Blocks on 1h

panels.description:
This is the current number of accounts that have local subjective billing.

It is the first authorizer account of a trx that has any subjective billing. It has submitted a trx that failed or has not yet been included in a block.
panels.title: Total subjective billed accounts from produced blocks on 1h

panels.description:
P2P First Available Blocks

“0” here means unknown. Only 5.0+ nodeos reports this info to peers. So the peer has to be 5.0+ for this to not be 0.
panels.title: P2P First Available Blocks

panels.description:
P2P Last Available Blocks

if a peer node is syncing and not at current block this might be less than current block number.
panels.title: P2P Last Available Blocks

panels.description:
P2P Unique First Block count

When receiving blocks from the network, this tells you which connection is sending you the most blocks first/it is a really good peer. Peers where you get no new blocks might be less important.
panels.title: P2P Unique First Block count on 1h
